page.title: 01LANDSCAPE DESCRIPTION
page.content: The landscape in this area is generally undulating except to the South east where the north slope of Largo Law is found rising to a maximum height of 290m.In the area there are several major streams which in places have been dammed to form small water storage reservoirs to supply local needs and provide recreational requirement the principal land uses in the area are mixed farming and forestry which is used as shelter belts and commercial plantations.The area has no major settlements and is crisscrossed by minor country roads which are surronded by attractive rural countryside.The main form of settlement is farmhouses of which Balmain ,Balcormo and Auchedownie are the main ones.
